definition: déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: On the other side compartments, Jenny and practicing very congenial, feel capable of deja vu.
sentences.chinese: 另边厢，珍妮与力行非常投契，感觉得力行似曾相识。

sentences.english: THE Bank of Japan (BoJ) must feel as if it has a bad case of déjà vu.
sentences.chinese: 日本银行一定感觉到了将会发生似曾相识的坏事。

sentences.english: Flowers fall off, do what one way, Swallows seem to be no strangers return.
sentences.chinese: 无可奈何花落去，似曾相识燕归来。

sentences.english: Finally, Iraq. Familiar material by now but telling nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 影片最后谈到伊拉克，各种的资料似曾相识。

sentences.english: As with deja vu, this entire process happens in a split second.
sentences.chinese: 对于这种“似曾相识”，整个过程仅发生在刹那之间。

sentences.english: What is going on in the brain when we experience déjà vu?
sentences.chinese: 似曾相识的感觉来袭时，大脑怎么了？

sentences.english: Old-timers watched the stock-market crash with a sense ofd�j� vu.
sentences.chinese: 老股民看到股市暴跌，有似曾相识之感。

sentences.english: Pass by, at both ends of the road, and suddenly look back, familiar.
sentences.chinese: 擦肩而过，路的两端，蓦然回首，似曾相识。

sentences.english: Many logos have the feeling of deja vu.
sentences.chinese: 很多的标志都有似曾相识的感觉。

definition: see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
to feel a rush of excitement (idiom)
to recall/to think of/to call to mind
to be familiar with/to know well
to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
